ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: Constructs paths to your project's files. The 'here()' function uses a reasonable heuristics to find your project's files, based on the current working directory at the time when the package is loaded. Use it as a drop-in replacement for 'file.path()', it will always locate the files relative to your project root.

Constructs paths to your project's files. The 'here()' function uses a reasonable heuristics to find your project's files, based on the current working directory at the time when the package is loaded. Use it as a drop-in replacement for 'file.path()', it will always locate the files relative to your project root.

name: r-here
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.0.2" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-here
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/here_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/here/here_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 71980aa294314d6e032e680dfd2a59f792cab6f8d414cce03f2e823819190c3d

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-rprojroot >=2.0.2
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-rprojroot >=2.0.2

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('here')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('here')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/krlmlr/here, http://krlmlr.github.io/here
  license: MIT
  summary: Constructs paths to your project's files. The 'here()' function uses a reasonable heuristics to find your project's files, based on the current working directory at the time when the package is loaded. Use it as a drop-in replacement for 'file.path()', it will always locate the files relative to your project root.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - brisk022
